content: brief intermission casual and satisfying knitting for the in-between times brief intermission is a bandana cowl knit from the point up starting back and forth then transitioning to in-the-round before finishing up garter stitch paired with slip stitches all the way the design is engi- neered without any flipping of the working yarn from front to back you ll thank me brief intermission works up quickly in worsted weight the pattern is adapted easily to other gauge yarns make a worsted one first yarn manos alegria grande 197 yds 100g 75% superwash merino 25% nylon - 1 skein materials needles us #8 24 circular stitch marker tape measure gauge pre-blocked 18 sts and 22 row over 4 in pattern stitch next page finished measurements 28 circumference 14 high note this pattern is engineered so that you re not flipping your working yarn back and forth from from back to front for slip stitches you re doing the slip row blind with the wrong side facing you occasionally check that your slip floats are making a brick pattern if you get off pattern check that you ve increased at the beginning and end of each wrong side row the rest row is a great place to rip back to if that becomes neces- sary pattern stitch worked flat cast on odd number of stitches gauge row 1 *k1 slip 1 wyib * repeat * to * to last stitch k1 gauge row 2 and all even row knit gauge row 3 *slip 1 wyib k1* repeat * to * to last stitch repeat 4 row to check gauge abbreviations kfb knit into the front and back of the stitch increases 1 wyib with yarn in back wyif with yarn in front instructions cast on 3 sts working flat back and forth row 1 ws kfb k1 kfb 5 sts on needle row 2 rs and all even row knit row 3 kfb *k1 slip 1 wyib * repeat * to * to last two stitches k1 kfb 7 sts on needle row 5 kfb *slip 1 wyib k1 * repeat * to * to last two stitches slip 1 wyib kfb 9 sts repeat row 5 and even knit row until piece measures 10 from cast on finish having just knit an even row cast on with the cable cast on method 19 stitches this can be an odd number of your choice fewer stitches will bring the neck opening closer to your chin for more cover- age connect in a circle being careful not to twist the cast on stitches place marker the right side slip side of the work should be facing you working in the round now round 1 rs p1 *slip 1 wyif p1 * repeat * to * to marker round 2 and all even rounds knit round 3 *slip 1 wyif p1 * repeat * to * to marker end having just worked an odd row and with enough yarn to bind off in knit
